oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Jan Plat's aunt Natta sang and taught the people the singing of the =gebbi-ggu. She could imitate (by singing) a ewe's call to its young as well as the call of a partridge, using different parts of her throat. 1) See also Picture of Mr Orpen's, 2) This story is found in Book V-25.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Jan Plat's aunt Natta sang the =gebbi-ggu
